title.narrative: Evaluating a group diabetes prevention program for high risk individuals in Kerala, India

description.narrative: The Kerala Diabetes Prevention Program (K-DPP) is a cluster randomised controlled trial of a culturally tailored and group-based lifestyle intervention program. K-DPP targets individuals at high risk of developing type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) in 60 neighbourhoods from a rural area of Thiruvananthapuram district in Kerala State, India. Globally, India has the largest number of individuals with T2DM (&#38;#62;51 million) and this is expected to double by 2030. While management of those already diagnosed with T2DM is very important, identifying those at high risk for developing T2DM and preventing or delaying the onset of the disease is urgently needed.
